title: What Cookies Do in Auth
description: How cookies are used to store session info for authentication.
content: Cookies are small pieces of data stored in the browser. In authentication, they usually hold a session ID that lets the server know who you are on each request.

flask.code:
# Flask sets a session cookie automatically
# You can access it with request.cookies.get('session')

django.code:
# Django sets a sessionid cookie
request.COOKIES.get('sessionid')
